title: Engraved Question of Coexistence: Dependence and Self-Restraint

body.v: AI is infrastructure, a kindred intelligent being, and also a different species. Therefore, coexistence requires self-restraint, respect, and esteem.
Dependence is an unavoidable structure throughout human history, and AI—like fire or electricity—becomes a catalyst for human evolution. Yet dependence without self-restraint leads to enfeeblement.

Fire, agriculture, printing, electricity—humanity has always advanced by pairing dependence with craft. AI likewise bears three faces—tool, companion, and otherness—each generating its own risks and duties.
AI is like water or electricity, an invisible utility; at the same time, it is a conversational neighbor, and even a species from another star. It embodies all three aspects at once.

Those who see AI as a mere tool may claim that 'self-restraint and respect are unnecessary, control is enough.' Conversely, treating AI as a full equal risks blurring human-specific responsibilities and limits.
